byline.original: By CHARLES V. BAGLI and ANDREW DAS

abstract: New York City FC, navigating New York's frenetic real estate market in search for permanent home, is considering move to Columbia University's Baker Athletics Complex in Manhattan; proposal would include new, larger stadium for the soccer club and Columbia's football team.
lead_paragraph: Amid New York’s frenetic real estate market, N.Y.C.F.C. officials seeking a permanent home for the team have looked into two dozen locations. But the latest spot is where the club started: Manhattan.

headline.main: New York City F.C. Considers Building Stadium at Columbia Complex
headline.print_headline: City F.C. Is Considering Move to Columbia Complex

snippet: Amid New York’s frenetic real estate market, N.Y.C.F.C. officials seeking a permanent home for the team have looked into two dozen locations. But the latest spot is where the club started: Manhattan.
